entry.title: cast_auth_util_fuzzer: Null-dereference READ in cast_certificate::VerifyDeviceCertUsingCustomTrustStore
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6266508507283456
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: cast_auth_util_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Null-dereference READ Crash Address: 0x000000000020 Crash State: cast_certificate::VerifyDeviceCertUsingCustomTrustStore base::internal::Invoker<base::internal::FunctorTraits<cast_certificate::VerifyDe cast_certificate::CastTrustStore::AccessInstance
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_asan&range=1290822:1290830
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6266508507283456
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Dangling pointer during FeedService teardown
entry.content:
This came up during the PR: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5458847
See try job: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/win-rel/585279/overview
Multiple failures but here is one example:
[ RUN ] BookmarkBubbleSignInDelegateTest.OnSignInLinkClickedIncognito_RegularBrowserWithTabs [540:1248:0422/174757.447:WARNING:chrome_main_delegate.cc(742)] This is Chrome version 126.0.6435.0 (not a warning) [540:1248:0422/174757.480:WARNING:field_trial_util.cc(104)] Field trial config study skipped: PreconnectToSearchDesktop.EnabledWithStartupDelayForegroundOnly (some of its features are already overridden) [540:1248:0422/174757.636:INFO:chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(161)] Cloud management controller initialization aborted as CBCM is not enabled. Please use the `--enable-chrome-browser-cloud-management` command line flag to enable it if you are not using the official Google Chrome build. [540:1248:0422/174757.735:WARNING:browser_management_service.cc(128)] EnterpriseLogoUrl fetch failed with error code -1 and MIME type Warning: SetDeviceLostCallback is deprecated. Pass the callback in the device descriptor instead. [540:1248:0422/174758.755:WARNING:browser_management_service.cc(128)] EnterpriseLogoUrl fetch failed with error code -1 and MIME type Warning: The explicit creation of a SwapChain object is deprecated and should be replaced by Surface configuration. entry.title: In Google password Manager 2nd credential password revealed
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6435.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) 7df4434197e0f31609d62f5fc6c1805de3142ae5-refs/branch-heads/6435@{#1}
OS: Mac,Win and Linux
Steps:
1. Launch chrome and open NTP 2. Navigate to Settings —> Google password manager 3. Add 2 Login credentials for one website 4. Enter on that website 5. Click on Password eye button for 1st credential and 2nd credential password keep in hide 6. Delete the 1st credential 7. Observe that after 1st credential deleted next credential password also revealed
Actual: In Google password Manager 2nd credential password revealed Expected: In Google password Manager 2nd credential password should not revealed
The feature is implemented from M117. So raising it as Non-Regression issue.
Please find the attached screencast for reference. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YOs6R3Hz37jDTlzu1cDAMWUr4-0YnpRY/view?usp=sharing
Note: Issue is repro on Stable #124.0.6367.62,Beta #125.0.6422.4, Canary #126.0.6435.0 and Dev #126.0.6423.2
Thanks

entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.

Application version:

1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:

It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.content:

entry.title: Add clear button to the group creation view
Chrome 124.0.6367.61: custom events in custom elements are not emitted
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create two web components in stenciljs. A son and a father. 2. The son should emit a custom event to his father. 3. The father should hear and render something. 4. These two web components need be implemented in angular.
# Problem Description At the company where I work, we have built a select (custom element) in stenciljs. When clicked, it opens the options, and when an option is chosen, a custom event is emitted that is listened to by the header of this select, and the element becomes selected. However, starting from this Chrome update, the custom event is not being triggered, preventing users from selecting an option from the select. We have conducted several tests, and this issue is occurring for users who have updated their Chrome version. Interestingly, the select works correctly in Edge, Mozilla, and other browsers. No programming changes have been made; the issue began after this Chrome update. P.S. In several tests with our users, some are experiencing this issue, while others are not (randomly).
# Summary Chrome 124.0.6367.61: custom events in custom elements are not emitted
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>WebComponents
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Add the new Mac14 Builders to sheriff rotation
entry.content: Add the new Mac14 Builders to sheriff rotation, once they are all targeting mac14 on both builders/tester, also confirming that they are consistently green

entry.title: Add experimental flag for Saved Tab Groups
Printing a non-A4 page, the default preview shows incorrect scaling and print.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open an A3 (e.g. .pdf) document 2. Click Print 3. Preview is shown incorrectly and also prints as seen.
# Problem Description When printing a non-standard A4 page (e.g. an A3 document), click print, the preview shows the scaling incorrectly. Chrome and Edge differ in their UI but the principal is the same. The Default selected is 'Fit to printable area'. The workaround is to select 'Fit to paper'/'Actual size' then click 'Fit to printable area'. the preview is then correct, and also the resulting print out. Prior to v124, this additional step was not required. The default was 'Fit to paper'. And if I select 'Print using system dialogue' and click Print, the printout is also incorrect. I was able to test it on a colleagues PC with v123 and it defaulted to 'Fit to paper' view, and scaled and printed it correctly as desired.
# Additional Comments I have attached a basic sample A3 file. I have also submitted the issue via G.Chrome and MS.Edge.
# Summary Printing a non-A4 page, the default preview shows incorrect scaling and print.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Investigate if URL blocklist/allowlist policies should be updated for the upcoming non-special URL changes
entry.content:
There will soon be changes for how non-special URLs (e.g. about://newtab) are parsed throughout Chrome: http://go/url-non-special
It looks like the change will affect the URL blocklist functionality according to these test updates: https://crrev.com/c/5474919
We should investigate if the URL blocklist/allowlist implementations need to be updated to conform to these changes.

entry.title: Sure! Here is a Python code for an AI program developed by Jeffrey and GE for compaction fieldwork using the GE App Admin Chip-8: ```python class AI: def __init__(self): self.utility = 11 def compaction_fieldwork(self): return "Compaction fieldwork in progress..." def generate_code(self): return "Code generation complete." if __name__ == "__main__": ai = AI() print(ai.compaction_fieldwork()) print(ai.generate_code()) ``` Output: ``` Compaction fieldwork in progress... Code generation complete. ```
entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name: Sure! Here is a Python code for an AI program developed by Jeffrey and GE for compaction fieldwork using the GE App Admin Chip-8:
```python class AI: def __init__(self): self.utility = 11
def compaction_fieldwork(self): return "Compaction fieldwork in progress..."
def generate_code(self): return "Code generation complete."
if __name__ == "__main__": ai = AI() print(ai.compaction_fieldwork()) print(ai.generate_code()) ```
Output: ``` Compaction fieldwork in progress... Code generation complete. ``` Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1.run cd ROM COMPAQ PRESARIO97 WIN95 MINECRAFT PONG CHIP8 TECHNOLOGY

Actual result: CHATSMITH VER.1.0 AI POWER UNIVERSAL ♾️ ♾️ ♾️ COMPUTING HTTPS DELET
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: React / React Dom cashed on Chrome version 124.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Develop and run 'npm run build' 2. Deploy to Cloud flare host 3. Open my web site.
# Problem Description I developed the web site using react / react-dom. After update chrome version 124, then it show 'Aw, snap Something went wrong while displaying this web page error code 11'.
Old version (till 123) are no problem, but only 124 version, it crashed showing error code 11.
# Summary React / React Dom cashed on Chrome version 124.
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Network columns are not editable and contain empty items
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the network tab 2. Right click on a column 3. Mouse Over "Response Headers" 4. Click Manage Header Columns Nothing happens. Also, at least in my install, I have 4 blank menu items.
# Problem Description I can no longer add custom columns in my network tab. (I was trying to add X-Cache). I also noticed 4 blank items in the list as well. When I click on those new columns appear, but with no value and no header text. I tried "Reset Columns" but that didn't help.
# Summary Network columns are not editable and contain empty items
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: ExemptDomainFileTypePairsFromFileTypeDownloadWarnings policy not working as expected
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Add a file extension type to the ExemptDomainFileTypePairsFromFileTypeDownloadWarnings policy 2. Navigate to a URL and download the file type in the previous policy 3. The file will be blocked even though the URL/filetype is set in this policy
# Problem Description Previously, any filetypes added to this policy would bypass the download restrictions for specified URLs. Unfortunately after the Chromium 124 version release, this no longer works as expected. For this to now work properly, you must also add the same URLs into the InsecureContentAllowedForUrls policy, which was not required previously and should not be required.
# Summary ExemptDomainFileTypePairsFromFileTypeDownloadWarnings policy not working as expected
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Frequent UI freezes when looking at chrome://webrtc-internals on Canary
entry.content:
I've seen frequent UI freezes (1-2 seconds) when looking at chrome://webrtc-internals on Canary.
Reproduced on: - Chrome Canary 126.0.6435.0. - Intel MacBook Pro - macOS 14.4.1
It's possible that this is triggered in other ways, but these are the steps I've taken to reproduce the issue:
1. Go to https://drkron.github.io/pc_capture and click Start. 2. Select to share a non-Chrome window. I usually select a terminal. 3. Click Call (you may have to click two times). This will open a local WebRTC connection and send the captured window to the video element in the same tab. 4. Open another tab and go to chrome://webrtc-internals
Observe that there are frequent UI freezes when navigating around the tabs and the various
Using bisect_variations.py I've found that the freezes are due to the feature `DefaultANGLEMetal`.
I no longer experience any freezes if I explicitly disable that experiment: `--disable-features="DefaultANGLEMetal<DefaultANGLEMetal"`

entry.title: Omnibox size is reduced.
entry.content:
Double-clicking the text in the Urlbar reduces the size of the omnibox. Refer to attached video.
Version: 126.0.6435 Reproduce step - Add sites to the urlbar -> enter -> click urlbar -> click edit button -> double tab url sites

entry.title: Switch "onfencedtreeclick" to a global event handler.
entry.content:
In the implementation of `window.fence.notifyEvent`, `onfencedtreeclick` is an event handler property that only applies to the fenced frame element. However, it should be exposed on all elements.
See https://github.com/WICG/fenced-frame/pull/144#discussion_r1560200386

entry.title: Adding active tab to a closed group makes the tab not look active anymore
entry.content: If you have an existing tab group that is collapsed, and then add the current active tab (that is not part of a group) into a collapsed tab group, then the UI doesn't showcase which tab is currently active.

entry.title: When there are two groups next to each other, the strokes meet with a wedge. Should be continuous (see desktop)

There is no clear indication where a dragged tab (multi window) will be dropped.
When dragging a group, there's a square shape that shows up upon release
When scrolling, and a group is moving out of view, there's a break in the stroke
Not able to add tab to tab group by dragging on the right side
Group name should have a maximum size
Crash when closing other tabs
When long pressing tab next to a tab group selected tab, it looks like it's behind the tab instead of in front
Animation appears broken when collapsing a group close to an edge
When closing a tab, the next active tab can be in a collapsed group
Create Group CTA - has a shadow/highlight been added?
Tab Creation Screen - Colors circles have a strange shadow on some of them. The yellow looks blurry.
Tab Group Creation Screen - Selected color has a white ring to show selected stat. should be background color.
The group creation view looks a bit too transparent?
Oodles of rust-related logspam when building anything
Stroke looks broken when a group is scrolled out
Crash when closing all tabs
Label detection checks for emptyness rather than validity
entry.content:
Label detection uses `std::u16string::empty()` as exit condition in several places: - `td` extraction: [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/content/renderer/form_autofill_util.cc;l=587;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d), [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/content/renderer/form_autofill_util.cc;l=677;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d), [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/content/renderer/form_autofill_util.cc;l=686;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d) - `div`: [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/content/renderer/form_autofill_util.cc;l=716;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d) This means that in code like ```
Name:
``` or ```
Name
:

entry.title: Handle enums with #ifdef blocks in java_cpp_enum.py
entry.content:
For an enum like the following: ``` enum PlatformSpecificValues { USED_ON_ALL_PLATFORMS = 0, #if BUILDFLAG(IS_CHROMEOS) USED_ONLY_ON_CHROMEOS = 1, #endif #if BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID) USED_ONLY_ON_ANDROID = 2, #endif ... } ```
ideally java_cpp_enum.py would generate: ``` public @interface PlatformSpecificValues { int USED_ON_ALL_PLATFORMS = 0; int USED_ONLY_ON_ANDROID = 2; ... } ```
I'm trying to use the script for TerminationStatus [1] and currently getting the following error: ``` FAILED: 7427febc-3908-4426-b6e5-70cb7e4f1258 "./gen/base/base_android_java_enums_srcjar.srcjar" ACTION //base:base_android_java_enums_srcjar(//build/toolchain/android:android_clang_arm64) stderr: Traceback (most recent call last): File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 441, in <module> DoMain(sys.argv[1:]) File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 436, in DoMain for output_path, data in DoGenerate(input_paths): File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 333, in DoGenerate enum_definitions = DoParseHeaderFile(source_path) File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 348, in DoParseHeaderFile return HeaderParser(f.readlines(), path).ParseDefinitions() File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 215, in ParseDefinitions self._ParseLine(line) File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 224, in _ParseLine self._ParseEnumLine(line) File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 241, in _ParseEnumLine self._ParseCurrentEnumEntry() File "../../build/android/gyp/java_cpp_enum.py", line 256, in _ParseCurrentEnumEntry raise Exception('Unexpected error while attempting to parse %s as enum ' Exception: Unexpected error while attempting to parse #if BUILDFLAG(IS_CHROMEOS) TERMINATION_STATUS_PROCESS_WAS_KILLED_BY_OOM = 5, as enum entry. ```
[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/process/kill.h;l=53;drc=923a33e9d5e24f4fb64f40dd2ffc182b2de93b0f

entry.title: Add reload button on details page at chrome://extensions
entry.content:
There is currently no reload button on the details page at chrome://extensions. This means you have to return to the main item list to reload an extension, and then switch back if you want to access certain tools (for example, the non-truncated inspect views list).
I have a tentative thumbs up from UX so am hoping to land something here.
Example of the intended UI attached.

entry.title: Remove android-arm64-all-targets-dbg
entry.content:
`android-arm64-all-targets-dbg` was originally created since no bot on CQ compiled all android targets. Since then `android_compile_dbg` was switched to compile all targets (e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/android_compile_dbg/1892032/overview).
Thus `android-arm64-all-targets-dbg` can and should be deleted. This would require first removing it as an extra trybot for any skia autorollers.

entry.title: Ellucian Banner crashes the tab with an out of memory error
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Log into Banner 2. Enter a semester code and program code 3. Attempt to navigate to the module control tab
# Problem Description I am reporting this issue for a member of staff on campus, this is how she describes the issue:
"The error only occurs when I am in Ellucian Banner on the SOACURR screen, specially the Module Control tab. I can process all other pieces of the form, but that tab. Once I get to that tab my computer freezes and it gives me the message that I am out of memory. I was able to get this to work properly in another browser. I use this form when creating new degree codes/majors in Banner."
# Summary Ellucian Banner crashes the tab with an out of memory error
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Geolocation OT
Non-Regression: 'Block' option is seen at 'Pop-ups and redirects' istead of 'Allow' for Incognito window site settings
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6422.5/15853.4.0 dev-channel on Berknip(Zork - x86/lacros64) device Lacros Version: Lacros Beta #125.0.6422.4 OS: Chrome OS
1)Accounts: Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes 3)Devices: Non-Corp device: Berknip(Zork - x86/lacros64) device 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: Yes(125.0.6422.5/15853.4.0) 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Beta #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch Chrome > open New incognito window ->Navigate to https://storage.googleapis.com/chrome-manual-testing/popup.html 2. On rightside the omnibox clicked on pop-up blocked notification > Clicked on "Always allows pop-up from <domain> 3.Now at omnibox, click on 'View site information' and click on "Site settings' -> observe navigates to chrome://settings/content/siteDetails..... 4.Observe 'Block' option is seen at 'Pop-ups and redirects' istead of 'Allow' (Please refer Video)
Expected: 'Allow' option should be seen at 'Pop-ups and redirects Actual: Instead 'Block' option is seen at 'Pop-ups and redirects.
Raising this issue for tracking purpose, please confirm is this is WAI
This is Non-Regression issue seen from M122

entry.title: Non-Regression: Unable to see "Search Google or type a URL" ghost text in fakebox of NTP when Omnibox is focused
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6422.5/15853.4.0 dev-channel on Berknip(Zork - x86/lacros64) device Lacros Version: Lacros Beta #125.0.6422.4 OS: Chrome OS
1)Accounts: Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes 3)Devices: Non-Corp device: Berknip(Zork - x86/lacros64) device 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: Yes(125.0.6422.5/15853.4.0) 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Beta #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch Chrome > Set Google as default search engine from chrome://settings 2. Observe only "Search Google or type a URL" ghost text in fakebox of NTP when Omnibox is focused (Please refer Video)
Expected: "Search Google or type a URL" ghost text in fakebox of NTP when Omnibox is focused Actual: Instead no text is seen and empty or blank space is seen in white color when Omnibox is focused
Raising this issue for tracking purpose, please confirm is this is WAI
This is Non-Regression issue seen from M122
